item.title: Linear Algebra - Intro
item.description:
WHY: Why we should learn Linear Algebra

  • It could help us better understand and solve Calculus in multi-dimentions
  • It is needed for Machine Learning especially Deep Learning

WHAT: What is Scalars, Vectors, and Matrices

Vector $\vec{v}$

Matrix $A$

WHY: Why should we know about Matrix

$$ \begin{cases} 2x - y = 0 \\ -x + 2y = 0 \end{cases} \Rightarrow \begin{pmatrix} 2 & -1 \\ -1 & 2 \end{pmatrix} \begin{pmatrix} x \\ y \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 0 \\ 0 \end{pmatrix} \Rightarrow Ax = b $$

WHAT: What is Matrix

  • It is an “arragement” of vectors $$ A = \begin{pmatrix} \vec{v} & \vec{w} & \ldots \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} v_1 & w_1 & \ldots \\ v_2 & w_2 & \ldots \\ \ldots & \ldots & \ldots\end{pmatrix} $$

  • It is an “arragement” of rows and columns $$ A = \begin{pmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 3 & 4 \\ 5 & 6 \end{pmatrix} \text{is a 3 by 2 matrix: m = 3 rows and n = 2 columns. Rank 2.} $$

WHAT: What is the rank of a Matrix

  • The Indepnedence and the dependence of the vectors in a metrix (column). $$ \exists \vec{x} \neq 0, Ax = 0 \Rightarrow \exists \vec{v} \in A, \vec{v} \text{ is not independent, or dependent to others vector (or columns)} $$

  • The Column Space of a matrix $$ C(A) \text{: All combinations of the columns} $$

HOW: How to do calculations with Matrices

  • Multiple Matrices

    • Addition
    • Combination
    • Multiplication: $A_{i \times k} B_{k \times j} = C_{i \times j}$
    • Elimination: $EA = U$

  • Single Matrix

    • Inverse: $A A^{-1} = I$
    • Transposes: $A A^T \text{symmetric}$
    • Derivative
